4)Add water, chilli flakes, black pepper, corn flour slurry, lemon juice and mix well.

name: Prawns Masala
ingredients: Prawns 1 kg (cleaned and deveined),Freshly prepared ginger garlic chilly paste 2 tbsp,Salt to taste,Lemon juice 1 tsp,red chilly powder 1 tsp,turmeric powder 1/4th tsp,tamarind pulp 1/4th cup,oil 3 tbsp,garlic cloves 8-10 (with skin),onions 3-4 medium size (chopped),red chilly powder 3 tbsp,coriander powder 1 tbsp,garam masala 2 tsp,fresh coriander 1 tbsp
recipe:
1)In a mixing bowl add the cleaned and deveined prawns, add freshly prepared ginger garlic chilly paste, salt to taste, lemon juice, red chilly powder, turmeric )owder and tamarind pulp. 
2)Mix well all the ingredients with the prawns and marinate it for 15-20 minutes.
3)Heat oil on a tawa or pan, add garlic cloves and fry for a minute. 
4)Add the chopped onions and cook until their translucent. 
5)Add the remaining add freshly prepared ginger garlic chilly paste, mix well. 
6)Cook until golden brown. Add the red chilly powder, coriander powder, garam masala, and mix well and cook for a minute. 
7)You can also use malwani/agri masala instead of garam masala.
8)Add the marinated prawns, and give it a nice mix.
9) Cook on medium high flame until the oil is released.
10)Add the freshly chopped coriander leaves, and mix well.
11)Your prawns masala is ready to served, serve hot with roti or bhakri.

name: Prawns Chilli
ingredients: 2 tbsp Cornflour,2 tbsp All Purpose Flour,1 tsp Garlic Paste,1 tsp Ginger Paste ,1 tbsp Dark Soy Sauce,1/4 tsp Black pepper Powder,1 Egg,300 gms Prawns,Oil,Ingredients For Slurry:1 tbsp Cornflour,1 tbsp Water
recipe:
1)Take cornflour in a bowl and add all purpose flour, garlic paste, ginger paste, dark soy sauce, black pepper powder to it    
 2) Now crack an egg to the mix, and whisk it without leaving any lumps 
3)Add deveined prawns to the bowl, and mix it nicely
 4) Now add these prawns to the hot oil, in a pan, and let it fry on each side 
5)Once fried, take it out on a plate and keep it aside  
 6) Take cornflour in a small bowl; add water to it and mix it  
 7) Now, take oil in a pan and add minced garlic, minced ginger to it 
8)Mix it till the raw smell goes away 
9) Add sliced spring onions to the pan, along with slit green chillies
10) Now, turn the flame to medium and add chopped capsicum, black pepper powder, dark soy sauce, chilli sauce to it and mix it
11) Add water to the pan and mix it, and then, add the slurry, fried prawns to the pan
 12) Mix it together and coat the prawns with the sauce 
13)Add salt, vinegar to the pan; mix it again and serve it.

name: Crispy Prawns
ingredients: 1 pound clean prawns in vinegar,leaving tails behind,1 tbsp minced garlic,1 tbsp lime juice,1/2 tsp salt,1/2 tsp ginger garlic paste,1 tsp chilli powder,1/4 tsp turmeric powder,2 tbsp corn flour,1/4 tsp pepper powder,pinch of salt,beat 1 egg in a bowl,add bread crumbs in a bowl,1 tbsp vinegar,1 tbsp soy sauce,pinch of salt,add chillies
recipe:
1)Mix first three steps ingredients well and keep aside for 1 hour.
2)Now, strain the prawns.take a dry bowl and add the prawns.
3)Mix the next three step ingredients well and keep aside for 20-30 minutes coating.
4)Take 1 tbsp all purpose flour.
5)Mix the next 3 ingredients well and keep aside.
6)Dip the marinated prawns in the flour.
7)Dip in the egg.coat well with bread crumbs frying.
8)Take required oil to deep fry.
9)When the oil is medium hot, place prawns gently.when golden brown, scoop out.
10)Serve with sauce

name: Broccoli Tandoori
ingredients: Broccoli florets 2 cups,Water for blanching,Mustard oil 1 tbsp,Red chilli powder 1 tbsp,Coriander powder 1 tbsp,Turmeric powder 1/4th tsp,Black salt 1 tsp,Amchur powder 1 tsp,Jeera powder 1 tsp,Garam masala 1 tsp,Ginger garlic paste,Thick curd ½ cup,Salt to taste
recipe:
1)Heat butter in a wok, add jeera and sauté for few seconds, add onions, ginger, garlic and kashmiri red chillies, cashew nuts, tomatoes and sauté for a minute, add salt, red chilli powder, coriander powder and garam masala, sauté for a minute. 
2)Add water, cover and cook for 6-7 minutes. 
3)Cool down to room temperature and grind well.
4)Heat oil and butter in a wok, add ginger and the gravy cook for a minute and add the tandoori broccoli, add salt and ½ tsp garam masala, kasuri methi, honey and fresh cream, cook for 2 minutes, add freshly chopped coriander.
5)Place a live charcoal in the centre and add few drops of ghee, cover and smoke for 5-6 minutes.
6)Serve hot with roti or paratha of your choice.

name: Broccoli Fry
ingredients: Broccoli-150 gm (washed),Gram flour-2 tbsp,Rice flour-1 tbsp,Cumin seeds-1/3 tsp,Turmeric powder-1/3 tsp,Red chilli powder-1/3 tsp,Cumin powder-1/3 tsp,Coriander powder-1/3 tsp,Dry mango powder-1 tsp,Cooking oil-2 tbsp,Salt to taste
recipe:
In a bowl: 
1)Add gram flour, rice flour, cumin powder, coriander powered, turmeric powder, red chilli powder, dry mango powder and salt.
2)Mix it properly and keep it aside.Heat a pan, add oil and let it heat properly.
3)Add cumin seeds and fry it for few seconds on medium flame.Add broccoli and fry it for 2-3 minutes on low-medium flame, keep stirring.
4)Add prepared masala mixture to the fried broccoli, keep stirring.
5)Fry it for 3-4 minutes on low-medium flame (do not cover the pan).
6)Once the masala coated broccoli turned golden brown, turn off the flame.
7)Ready to serve.

name: Broccoli Roasted
ingredients: 2lbs/900g broccoli cut up,2 lemons,1 garlic head,olive oil,honey as needed,1/4 cup parsley optional
recipe:
1)Heat oven to 425 degrees Fahrenheit or 220 degrees Celsius. 
2)Cut lemons in half. Cut off garlic head to expose all cloves.
3)Put a tablespoon of olive oil in a baking dish. 
4)Place cut lemons in dish and rub all over with olive oil. 
5)Sprinkle with salt. 
6)Roast in heated oven for 45 minutes.

name: Peas Katchori
ingredients: 1 cup maida / plain flour / all-purpose flour,1 tsp semolina / rava / sooji,salt to taste,3 tbsp oil / ghee,water to knead to dough,oil for deep frying,For kachori stuffing:1 cup peas / matar (fresh / frozen),2 tsp oil,1 inch ginger / adrak,1 green chilli,½ tsp cumin seeds / jeera,¼ tsp turmeric / haldi,salt to taste,½ tsp kashmiri red chili powder / lal mirch powder,½ tsp coriander powder / daniya powder,pinch ofhing / asafoetida,¼ tsp garam masala powder,¼ tsp aamchur powder / dry mango powde,2 tbsp coriander leaves (finely chopped),¼ tsp fennel / saunf (crushed)
recipe:
1)Firstly, in a small blender take peas, ginger and chilli.
2)Blend to coarse paste without. keep aside.further, in a large kadai heat oil.
3)Add in cumin seeds and saute till they turn aromatic.
4)Also add in spices and saute.
5)Further add blended peas and saute.
6)Also add salt and coriander leaves. 
7)Mix and keep aside.
Kachori dough recipe:
1)Firstly, in a large mixing bowl add maida, rava and oil and salt.
2)Crumble the flour well with oil.in addition, add water and knead to form a dough. 
3)Rest for 15 mins.now pinch a ball sized ball and flatten it.
4)Scoop prepared matar stuffing.get the edges together and form a bundle.
5)Deep fry kachoris to golden brown.finally, serve matar kachori.

name: Peas Puloa
ingredients: 1 tbsp ghee / clarified butter,1 tsp cumin seeds / jeera,5 cloves / lavang,1 bay leaf / tej patta,1 star anise / chakr phool,1 inch cinnamon stick / dalchini,10 black pepper / kali mirch,3 cardamom / elachi,1 medium sized onion (thinly sliced),1 small green chili (slit lenthwise),1 tsp ginger garlic paste,1 cup peas / matar (fresh / frozen),1 cup basmati rice (soaked 30 minutes),1.5 cups water,salt to taste
recipe:
1)Firstly, in a cooker heat ghee and add cumin seeds.
2)Further add cloves, bay leaf, star anise, cinnamon stick, black pepper and cardamom. 
3)Saute till they turn aromatic.furthermore, saute onions till they turn translucent.
4)Also saute green chili and ginger-garlic paste.
5)Additionally add green peas and saute well. 
6)Either add fresh or frozen peas.further add basmati rice soaked for atleast 30 minutes and saute gently.
7)Now add 1.5 cups of water. always add 1.5 cups of water to 1 cup of basmati rice.
8)Additionally add salt to taste and mix well.pressure cook for 2 whistles on medium flame.
9)Once the pressure releases from the cooker, gently fluff.
10)Finally, serve peas pulao or mattar pulao with raita or with paneer curries.

name: Peas Curry
ingredients: 3 tsp oil,1 tsp cumin / jeera,½ tsp cinnamon,3 pods cardamom,3 cloves,1 bay leaf / tej patta,1 tsp dry fenugreek leaves / kasuri methi,pinch of hing / asafoetida,1 onion (finely chopped),2 green chilli (slit),1 tsp ginger garlic paste,1 cup tomato (finely chopped),½ tsp turmeric / haldi,1 tsp kashmiri red chilli powder / lal mirch powder,1 tsp coriander powder,3 cup water
recipe:
1)Firstly, in a pressure cooker take 3 tsp oil and saute spices.
2)Now saute 1 onion, 2 green chilli and 1 tsp ginger garlic paste.also, saute 1 cup tomato until it turns soft and mushy.
3)Furthermore, add spices and 1 tsp salt.saute on low flame, till the oil releases from tomato.
4)Now add 1 cup black chana or kala chana soaked overnight. 
5)Saute for a minute.add 3 cups of water and mix well.
6)Cover and pressure cook for 8 whistles or till chana get cooked completely.
7)Now add ½ tsp garam masala, 2 tbsp coriander and mix well.
8)Finally, serve kala chana curry with rice or roti.

name: Coriander Chutney
ingredients: 1 ½ Cup Coriander Leaves,½ Cup Mint Leaves,2 Green Chillies,1 Inch Ginger,1 tbs Peanuts,½ tsp Chat Masala,½ tsp Cumin Seed Powder,1 tsp Sugar,Salt,Lime Juice,Water
recipe:
1)In a mixer, add coriander leaves, mint leaves, green chillies, ginger, peanuts, chat masala, cumin seed powder and sugar.
2)In order to maintain the color of the green chutney, add salt and lime juice in the end.Grind everything well.
3)Add water that's enough to grind.
4)Coriander Mint Chutney is ready!

name: Coriander Rice
ingredients: Cooked Rice (as per requirement),1 tbsp ghee or clarified butter,1 tsp cumin seeds,2 pieces of cardamom,2 pieces of cloves,Few pieces of cinnamon sticks,1 small piece of star anise,1 large onion, chopped finely,1 capsicum, chopped finely,Half a cup of french beans,1 carrot, chopped into half-inch pieces,1/2 a cup of green peas
recipe:
1)Heat oil and ghee in a pan and add cumin seeds, cardamom cloves, cinnamon sticks, and star anise. 
2)Cook till cumin seeds turn slightly brown and onions and saute them for a minute. 
3)Then add capsicum, french beans, carrot, and green peas to it and let it cook. 
4)Add 2-3 tbsp. water and salt and cover the pan with a lid and let the vegetables cook for 2-3 minutes. 
5)Once done, add the coriander paste to the cooked vegetables and cook it for 2 minutes. X
6)Then add coriander powder, cumin powder, and rice. 
7)Mix it nicely and add salt to taste, coriander leaves, 1 tbsp water, and toss it lightly with 2 spoons. 
8)Cover with a lid and let it simmer for a minute.

name: Coriander Podi
ingredients: Coriander Leaves -1 big bunch,Bengal gram/kadalai paruppu -1/4 cup,Urad dal -1/4 cup,Red Chillies -8-10,Asafoetida – a pinch,Oil-1/2 tsp,Salt to taste
recipe:
1)Wash coriander leaves well and drain the water completely. 
2)Chop it finely along with the stem.You can use the tender stem also for this recipe. 
3)Spread it on a cloth and dry the coriander leaves in the shade for 6-7 hours. 
4)After drying, I got 2 cups of coriander leaves. 
5)The color of the leaves will remain green even after drying for 6-7 hours in the shade.

name: Coriander Soup
ingredients: 2 tsp oil,2 clove garlic (finely chopped),1 inch ginger (finely chopped),1 onion (finely chopped),2 tbsp coriander stem (finely chopped),1 carrot (finely chopped),2 tbsp cabbage (shredded),2 tbsp beans (finely chopped),2 tbsp sweet corn,3 cup water,1 tsp salt
recipe:
1)Firstly, in a large kadai heat 2 tsp oil and saute 2 clove garlic, 1 inch ginger.
2)Also, saute ½ onion and 2 tbsp coriander stem for a minute.
3)Now add ½ carrot, 2 tbsp cabbage, 2 tbsp beans, 2 tbsp sweet corn.Saute for a minute without overcooking.
4)Further, add 3 cup water, ½ tsp salt and ½ tsp pepper powder.
5)Mix well and boil for 5 minutes.
6)Prepare the cornflour slurry by mixing 1 tbsp cornflour and ¼ cup water.
7)Mix well making sure there are no lumps.

name: Coriander Vadi
ingredients: 2 cups coriander leaves (finely chopped),1 cup besan / gram flour / chickpea flour,1 tsp ginger-garlic pastem,1 tsp kashmiri red chilli powder / lal mirch powder,1 tsp turmeric / haldi,1 green chilli (finely chopped),1 tsp coriander powder,1 tsp cumin powder
recipe:
1)Firstly, in a large mixing bowl take 2 cups of chopped coriander leaves.
2)Also add 1 cup of besan.
3)Additionally add 1 tsp ginger-garlic paste, 1 green chilli, ½ tsp red chilli powder, ½ tsp turmeric, ½ tsp coriander powder, ½ tsp cumin powder, ¼ tsp garam masala powder, 1 tsp sesame seeds, salt and 1 tsp lemon juice.
4)Combine well making sure all the spices are mixed well.
5)Also squeeze and mix making sure the coriander leaves are squeezed well.
6)Further add water as required and begin to knead.Knead to soft dough.

name: Cabbage Paratha
ingredients: 2 tsp oil,1 tsp coriander seeds (crushed),2 tsp ajwain,3 cup cabbage (finely chopped),1 tsp ginger paste,1 tsp kashmiri red chilli powder,1 tsp turmeric,1 tsp cumin powder
recipe:
1)Firstly, to prepare stuffing heat 2 tsp oil and saute ½ tsp coriander seeds and ¼ tsp ajwain until they turn aromatic.Now add 3 cup cabbage and saute for 2 minutes.
2)Add ½ tsp ginger paste, ½ tsp chilli powder, ¼ tsp turmeric, ½ tsp cumin powder, ¼ tsp garam masala, ½ tsp aamchur and ½ tsp salt.
3)Stir fry until cabbage is cooked well.Now add 2 tbsp coriander and mix well. Stuffing is ready.
4)To prepare the dough, in a large bowl take 2½ cup wheat flour, ½ tsp salt and 2 tbsp oil. Mix well.
5)Now add 1 cup water and knead a dough.Knead to a smooth and soft dough adding water as required.
6)Now grease 1 tsp oil, cover and rest for 20 minutes.Firstly, pinch a ball sized wheat dough and dust with some wheat flour.
7)Further, roll it in a circle of about 5 to 5.5 inches in diameter.
8)Place a ball sized prepared cabbage stuffing in the centre.

name: Cabbage Dosa
ingredients: For soaking:1 cup rice,2 tbsp urad dal,1 tsp methi,water (for soaking),10 dried red chilli,For masala paste:1 cup coconut (grated),2 tbsp coriander seeds,1 tbsp cumin,1 cup jaggery,3 tbsp tamarind pulp,1 tsp turmeric,1 tsp salt,Other ingredients:3 cup cabbage (finely chopped),1 cup water
recipe:
1)Add 1 cup coconut, 2 tbsp coriander seeds, 1 tbsp cumin, ¼ cup jaggery, 3 tbsp tamarind pulp, ½ tsp turmeric and 1 tsp salt.
2)Grind to smooth paste adding water as required.
3)Transfer the masala paste into a large bowl and keep aside.
4)In the same mixi take soaked rice.Blend to smooth paste.
5)Now transfer the rice batter to the same bowl of the masala paste.
6)Mix well making sure everything is well combined. Note, always grind rice and masala separately, else masala paste will not be smooth.
7)Further, add 3 cup of cabbage and 1 cup water.
8)Mix well forming a smooth flowing consistency dosa batter.
9)Grease the pan and pour a ladleful of batter. 
10)Spread gently keeping slightly thick.Now pour ½ tsp coconut oil.
11)Cover and cook for a minute, until the dosa is cooked well.Flip over and cook on another side. 
12)Recommend cooking both sides as the dosa is slightly thick and cabbage is raw.
